item.title: Word of the Day: compensation
item.description: This word has appeared in 1,406 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Life and Death in India’s Air Apocalypse
item.description: For hundreds of millions of Indians, toxic winter air poisons bodies, constricts lives and wears down spirits.
item.dc:creator: Anurag Minus Verma

media:content.media:credit: Vani Bhushan for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Hazy skies laden with harmful particulates settle in every winter over vast areas of India such as this congested road in New Delhi.

item.title: HUD Accuses Boston of Racial Discrimination in Housing Policies
item.description: The Department of Housing and Urban Development is investigating whether the city’s focus on affordable housing for people of color violated federal law.
item.dc:creator: Francesca Regalado

media:content.media:credit: Sophie Park for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The Department of Housing and Urban Development accused Boston of encouraging banks and real estate developers to work with communities of color, rather than all low-income households.

item.title: China Is Getting Much of What It Wants From the U.S., Including Chips
item.description: For China, President Trump’s moves to loosen chip controls, soften U.S. rhetoric and stay silent on tensions with Japan amount to a rare string of strategic gains.
item.dc:creator: Lily Kuo

media:content.media:credit: Haiyun Jiang/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump and Xi Jinping, China’s leader, after their meeting in Busan, South Korea, in October. Mr. Trump’s latest moves extended the conciliatory posture he struck at this summit.

item.title: El gobierno de Japón emitió un aviso de megaterremoto. ¿Qué significa?
item.description: Las autoridades japonesas afirman que las probabilidades de un terremoto de magnitud 8 han aumentado, aunque no se puede predecir cuándo ocurrirá uno.
item.dc:creator: Jin Yu Young

media:content.media:credit: Jiji Press, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Un vehículo se tambalea sobre una carretera derrumbada en la ciudad de Tohoku, frente a la costa del norte de Japón.

item.title: Why It’s Best to Imagine the Worst
item.description: After learning devastating news about our young son, we needed to feel connected to friends and family, not just exist beyond their imagination.
item.dc:creator: Tanmeet Sethi

media:content.media:credit: Brian Rea

item.title: Corrections: Dec. 12, 2025
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Friday, Dec. 12, 2025.

item.title: They Run a Grocery Store Together. Now They’re Walking Down the Aisle.
item.description: Gretty Garcia and Jesse Clemente left full-time jobs in advertising and journalism to help with one of her parents’ businesses in the Bronx.
item.dc:creator: Emily Lang

item.title: She’s in Gaza. He’s in Cairo. Separated by a Closed Border, They Married Remotely.
item.description: Mayar Kabaja and Hatem Saadallah went on their first date in Gaza City 10 days before Oct. 7, 2023. He and his family evacuated to Egypt over 18 months ago, and the two have not been able to see each other since.
item.dc:creator: Sadiba Hasan

media:content.media:credit: Saher Alghorra for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Mayar Kabaja and Hatem Saadallah were married on Oct. 27. Unable to reunite until the Rafah border crossing reopens, they were wed in a ceremony that took place with a power of attorney and Mr. Saadallah on the phone.

item.title: Two Scots Choose a Wintry New York for a Would-Be Elopement
item.description: Lauren Aitchison and Tommy Kerr made a marriage plan shortly after falling in love in Glasgow, but her mother was soon on to them.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Block

item.title: He Fell in Love With the Video Game-Themed Artwork, Then the Artist
item.description: Hector Perez admired Adrianny Almonte’s mural in Santo Domingo, but he didn’t know she had painted it until he stumbled on a Facebook post.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Vora

item.title: Quote of the Day: States Raking In Billions From the Slot Machines on Your Phone
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Friday, December 12, 2025.

item.title: Trump Signs A.I. Executive Order
item.description: Trump signed an executive order on Thursday that would limit individual states in regulating the artificial intelligence industry.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Paik

media:content.media:credit: Doug Mills/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump, who has said it’s important for America to dominate in the race to develop A.I., has said that the various state A.I. laws have created a confusing patchwork of regulations.

item.title: Reddit Sues Australian Government to Block Social Media Ban
item.description: The company said the new law, which makes it illegal for children under 16 to have social media accounts, infringes on children’s rights.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Kim

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: School children waiting for a bus in Sydney, last month. The ban took effect on Wednesday.

item.title: Map: 6.7-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Off Japan
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.
item.dc:creator: William B. Davis, Madison Dong, Judson Jones, John Keefe, Joey K. Lee and Bea Malsky

media:content.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: Navy Submits Investigation on Senator to Hegseth’s Office
item.description: The report concerns a video in which Senator Mark Kelly, a retired Navy captain, and five other Democratic lawmakers reminded military members of their obligation to refuse illegal orders.
item.dc:creator: John Ismay
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

media:content.media:credit: Kenny Holston/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The Secretary of the Navy, John Phelan, appearing before the Senate in February.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Dec. 12, 2025
item.description: Adrian Johnson and Jess Rucks open our solving weekend with a treat.
item.dc:creator: Deb Amlen

media:content.media:credit: Jon Kopaloff for Searchlight Pictures — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: I scream, you scream, we all scream for Adrian Johnson and Jess Rucks’s puzzle.

item.title: Arkansas Public Television Drops PBS
item.description: The loss of federal funding forced a difficult decision, the executive director of Arkansas TV said: Cut PBS, or go off the air entirely.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Mullin

media:content.media:credit: Kristoffer Tripplaar/Sipa, via AP Images
media:content.media:description: The headquarters of the Public Broadcasting Service in Arlington, Va.

item.title: 艺术家高兟的狱中情书
item.description: 曾创作批评文革作品的艺术家高兟2024年回中国探亲时被捕，如今在等待审判，罪名是涉嫌侵害英雄烈士名誉。他的妻儿被禁止离开中国，高兟从狱中寄出信件和手撕画作，寄托对家人的爱意和思念。
item.dc:creator: Lily Kuo and Andrea Verdelli

item.title: Trump Symbolically Pardons Tina Peters, Colorado Clerk Convicted of Election Tampering
item.description: Tina Peters was sentenced for a Colorado state crime that the president has no ability to pardon. President Trump has no legal power to free her from prison.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron and Alan Feuer

media:content.media:credit: Daniel Brenner for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Tina Peters was sentenced to nine years in prison after being found guilty of tampering with voting equipment after the 2020 election.

item.title: Democrats Press Noem on Harsh Immigration Tactics
item.description: Some Democratic lawmakers pressed Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem on the Trump administration’s aggressive immigration enforcement tactics during a hearing on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Mitssunaga

media:content.media:credit: Kenny Holston/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Kristi Noem, the homeland security secretary, faced a panel of lawmakers at a time when the federal government is stepping up its immigration enforcement efforts and seeking to increase deportations.

item.title: Stuck in Quicksand, a Hiker in Utah Has His SOS Answered
item.description: Austin Dirks used a Garmin satellite device to reach emergency responders, who rescued him in a remote canyon in Arches National Park.
item.dc:creator: Neil Vigdor

media:content.media:credit: Daniel Brenner for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Visitors at Arches National Park in Moab, Utah, in 2024.

item.title: Hiker Rescued From Quicksand in Arches National Park
item.description: Austin Dirks was on a solo hike in Arches National Park when he got stuck in quicksand. Emergency responders rescued him after he sent an SOS message using a satellite device.
item.dc:creator: Rex Sakamoto

media:content.media:credit: Daniel Brenner for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Visitors at Arches National Park in Moab, Utah, in 2024.

item.title: Kenya Is Betting its Economic Future on Women Willing to Risk it All
item.description: We set out to investigate worker abuse in Saudi Arabia. We found a system that begins exploiting them before they ever leave home.

media:content.media:credit: Kiana Hayeri for The New York Times

item.title: Lawsuit Seeks to Stop Oil Exploration in Remote Areas of the Arctic
item.description: A federal lawsuit argues that proposed work by ConocoPhillips could threaten delicate ecosystems in the largest tract of public land in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Karen Zraick

media:content.media:credit: Erin Schaff/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A ConocoPhillips oil drilling site on the North Slope of Alaska near the Willow site, another ConocoPhillips oil exploration project.

item.title: Key Takeaways After Indiana Lawmakers Defy Trump’s Redistricting Push
item.description: President Trump’s failure to ram through a Republican-friendly House map was a new sign that his iron grip on the party has slipped, and was likely to reverberate nationally.
item.dc:creator: Nick Corasaniti and Mitch Smith

media:content.media:credit: Jon Cherry for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Republican members of the Indiana Senate voted on Thursday to reject an effort led by President Trump to pass a congressional map that would have given the party two extra House seats.

item.title: ‘Storm Highway’ Forecast to Send More Rain to Washington and British Columbia
item.description: Just as this week’s floodwaters in the Pacific Northwest begin to recede, forecasters warn, another storm will approach the West Coast.
item.dc:creator: Amy Graff

media:content.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: Trump Moves to Stop States From Regulating AI With a New Executive Order
item.description: The order would create one federal regulatory framework for artificial intelligence, President Trump told reporters in the Oval Office.
item.dc:creator: Cecilia Kang

media:content.media:credit: Doug Mills/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump, who has said it’s important for America to dominate in the race to develop A.I., has said that the various state A.I. laws have created a confusing patchwork of regulations.

item.title: ¿Cómo afecta la incautación de buques petroleros a la economía de Venezuela?
item.description: Venezuela depende excepcionalmente del petróleo para mantener en funcionamiento el gobierno y pagar las necesidades básicas.
item.dc:creator: Simon Romero

media:content.media:credit: Adriana Loureiro Fernandez para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Un buque petrolero atracado en la refinería de Cardón, Venezuela, en 2021.

item.title: Republicans Undercut Johnson, Circumventing Him to Force Votes
item.description: The speaker has repeatedly lost his grip on the House floor thanks to a once rare parliamentary maneuver that G.O.P. members are increasingly using to force action on legislation.
item.dc:creator: Michael Gold
item.category: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Speaker Mike Johnson’s hold on his razor-thin majority has become increasingly slippery, as rank-and-file Republicans flout his wishes.

item.title: U.S. Issues New Sanctions Targeting Maduro’s Family and the Oil Sector
item.description: The United States is escalating its pressure campaign on Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro, after seizing an oil tanker off the coast.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Nehamas, Tyler Pager, Farnaz Fassihi and Alan Rappeport

media:content.media:credit: Adriana Loureiro Fernandez for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Nicolás Maduro during a rally in Caracas on Wednesday.

item.title: Calvin McDonald, Lululemon CEO, Will Depart Yoga Clothing Maker in January
item.description: The maker of yoga clothing is looking for a new leader after public pressure from the company’s founder.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Hirsch

media:content.media:credit: Alana Paterson for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Calvin McDonald, the chief executive of Lululemon Athletica, will leave at the end of January.

item.title: Federal Judge Blocks FEMA From Canceling Climate Resiliency Grants
item.description: A Thursday ruling said the Trump administration cannot eliminate the Building Resilient Infrastructure and Communities program without Congress.
item.dc:creator: Scott Dance

media:content.media:credit: Ed Jones/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: A flood defense project on the East Side of Manhattan in 2021.

item.title: The Duality in Conservative Politics
item.description: Andrew Kolvet of Turning Point USA explains why he endorses a tough-love approach to politics on this episode of “Interesting Times.”
item.dc:creator: Interesting Times

item.title: The ‘Wildness’ of Right-Wing Conspiracy
item.description: On a recent episode of “Interesting Times,” Andrew Kolvet shares what it’s like to be on the receiving end of conspiracy theories from other conservative influencers after Charlie Kirk’s assassination.
item.dc:creator: Interesting Times

item.title: The Coziest New Ski Lodges in the Alps
item.description: Five of the most notable newcomers to Europe’s winter resort scene are small hotels with distinctive personalities — and enough amenities to keep indoor types happy too.
item.dc:creator: Adam H. Graham

item.title: Affordable Care Act Subsidies Are Set to Expire
item.description: Also, Indiana Republicans rejected Trump’s redistricting push. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cullen

media:content.media:credit: Kenny Holston/The New York Times

item.title: Home Security Camera Captures Gas Line Explosion in Bay Area
item.description: A home security camera recorded the moment a building across the street exploded after a construction crew damaged multiple gas lines in Hayward, Calif.
item.dc:creator: Jamie Leventhal

item.title: Una jueza ordena liberar a Kilmar Abrego Garcia de la custodia del ICE
item.description: El fallo significa que Abrego Garcia quedará libre y, al menos por ahora, fuera de la inminente amenaza de ser deportado nuevamente.
item.dc:creator: Alan Feuer

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia durante una vigilia en Baltimore el 25 de agosto. Ese mismo día fue detenido de nuevo, y desde entonces permanece bajo custodia.

item.title: Do Kwon, Crypto Entrepreneur Who Caused 2022 Crash, Sentenced to 15 Years
item.description: Do Kwon, who designed the virtual currencies Luna and TerraUSD, which plunged in 2022, had pleaded guilty to fraud.
item.dc:creator: Emmett Lindner and David Yaffe-Bellany

media:content.media:credit: Risto Bozovic/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Do Kwon, a crypto entrepreneur who went on the run after the crash of two virtual currencies that he created, was escorted by Montenegro police in 2024.

item.title: 6 Injured and 2 Missing in Bay Area Neighborhood Gas Explosion
item.description: A gas line explosion in Hayward, Calif., sent multiple victims to the hospital and led to a fire that burned several houses.
item.dc:creator: Soumya Karlamangla

item.title: D.L. Coburn, Playwright With a Solo Hit, ‘The Gin Game,’ Dies at 87
item.description: His two-character work won a Pulitzer Prize and had a long Broadway run, but he never replicated its success and struggled to get his later work staged.
item.dc:creator: Trip Gabriel

media:content.media:credit: Playbill
media:content.media:description: Hume Cronyn and Jessica Tandy — husband and wife in real life — starred in the original Broadway production of “The Gin Game,” directed by Mike Nichols.

item.title: America Is Entering Its Third Civil War
item.description: Trump is not interested in refighting the Cold War. He is, in my view, interested in fighting the civilizational war over what is the American “home.”
item.dc:creator: Thomas L. Friedman

media:content.media:credit: Alex Kent for The New York Times

item.title: Man Accused in Charlie Kirk Killing Makes First Court Appearance in Person
item.description: Tyler Robinson faces murder charges in Utah in the Sept. 10 assassination of Mr. Kirk, the political activist and ally of President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Christina Morales

media:content.media:credit: Pool photo by Rick Egan
media:content.media:description: Tyler Robinson, accused in the murder of Charlie Kirk, appears during a hearing in Provo, Utah, on Thursday.

item.title: What to Know About Trump’s Seizure of an Oil Tanker Near Venezuela
item.description: The tanker was headed eastward and had recently carried Iranian oil. The seizure is an escalation in President Trump’s military pressure campaign against Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro.
item.dc:creator: Edward Wong and Nicholas Nehamas

media:content.media:credit: Planet Labs, via Reuters
media:content.media:description: A satellite image showing the Skipper, an oil tanker, near Port Jose, Venezuela, in November.

item.title: S&P 500 Reaches Record High as Stocks Reverse Downturn
item.description: The S&P 500 edged higher as investors shrugged off concerns over Oracle’s earnings. It was just enough.
item.dc:creator: Joe Rennison
